results.title: World of plenty
results.brief_description: This wartime story of man and the food necessary for his survival is told by two men - a commentator and an interjector. The many-faceted problem of ensuring adequate production of essential foods, and a fair and even distribution of foods throughout the world, is challengingly presented.
results.description: This wartime story of man and the food necessary for his survival is told by two men - a commentator and an interjector. results.title: World of pets : Fish
results.creator_credit: Dennis B. Kane and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of pets”.
This film explores the world of fish by demonstrating to students how to set up an aquarium and how to care for goldfish, as well as a practical discussion of the anatomy, perception and breeding behaviour of fish. Students will discover that fish not only make colourful pets but that they also can be used to explore animal behaviour and to teach responsibility. Suitable for Middle-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: World of pets : dogs
results.creator_credit: Chris Brown and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of pets”.
This film explores the world of the dog as a companion to humans. By focussing on a golden retriever and her puppies, from birth to maturity, we observe the dog’s behaviour as it interacts with other dogs and the human family which adopts it. Suitable for Middle-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: World of Pets
results.creator_credit: Alan Degen, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Each program looks at a particular pet and shows how you can learn about animal behavior through the care of animals. The programs also give tips on how to look after pets.

results.title: World of little things
results.creator_credit: Moody Institute of Science. Educational Film Division
results.brief_description: Looks at the historical background of the microscope and studies the life forms often found in a drop of water - amoeba, volvox, paramecium, and didinium. Also shows the structure and nature of other marine life such as medusa and flatworms.

results.title: World of darkness
results.brief_description: Edited from the motion picture entitled ‘Strange creatures of the night’, the film examines a variety of creatures, including bats, owls, and a blind lizard that live and hunt in the darkness. Excellent footage of the animals in their natural environment. There is an information booklet inside each can.

results.title: World of commerce
results.creator_credit: Bruce McNaughton, Ronald Mason, Academy Film Productions and Golden Fleece
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Way to Tomorrow”.
Illustrates the range of occupations in the busy world of commerce available to both boys and girls. Gives examples of occupations in banking and other financial jobs associated with production, marketing and transport. Considers the need for documents, systems of book keeping and administrative skills required, and gives advice on training opportunities for commercial careers.
